educational_objective: Identify Roth spots associated with infective endocarditis.
question_text: A 19-year-old man with substance use disorder is evaluated for 3 weeks of fever and malaise and a new heart murmur.Funduscopic findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is infective endocarditis (Option C). This funduscopic image shows Roth spots with a white/paler center (arrows). These hemorrhagic lesions of the retina are associated with infective endocarditis and certain leukemias.
